column4: I cannot figured out how to use update-alternaitves, could I get a hand please?
What seems to be the issue?
I cannot use openJDK and I want to have all app expecting it to use the Sun JDK I've installed.  I've changed all the PATHs I can think of, no help
All you need to do is run sudo update-java-alternatives
er, I think that requires an argument, so use the -l and -s
hmm seems i have to have openjdk installed to do this
so i have openjdk installed, and I took the Sun JDK, used alien to turn it into a deb, and then installed that
when I run  update-java-alternatives -l , i see openjdk
because its the Sun JDK that I need
and it doesnt come as a deb
alien is really really really not reccomended.
enable the partner repository and then install the relevant sun-java-* package you want.
blargh, ok how to do I unstall the alien pkg?
